snippet: Syria pulled both Turkey and Israel closer to its civil war on Monday, bombing a rebel-held Syrian village near the Turkish border and provoking Israeli tank commanders in Golan Heights.
abstract: Syria pulls both Turkey and Israel closer to military entanglements in its civil war, bombing rebel-held Syrian village near Turkish border and provoking Israeli tank commanders in disputed Golan Heights into blasting mobile Syrian artillery unit across their own armistice line; escalations come hours after fractious Syrian opposition announced broad new unity pact.

byline.original: By SEBNEM ARSU and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu reported from Gaziantep, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Isabel Kershner contributed reporting from Jerusalem, and Hania Mourtada and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon.
